definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: If you would have told me that before CES, I probably would have laughed my head off.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在CES之前告诉我这些，我也许会笑掉大牙。

sentences.english: I didn't tell George when he came home. Or he'd have laughed his head off.
sentences.chinese: 乔治回家时我没敢告诉他，否则他会笑掉大牙的。

sentences.english: Employees are likely to laugh their tails off at any boss who cites this drivel as inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 老板要把这一派胡言奉为灵感，雇员可能会笑掉大牙。

sentences.english: I am sure the iCon Mr Jobs is laughing his head off.
sentences.chinese: 世界上有那么多的傻瓜，乔布斯先生会笑掉大牙。

sentences.english: I was laughed out of twelve interviews today.
sentences.chinese: 今天十二个面试我都让人笑掉大牙了。
